intro: Secamone cristata subsp. clavata, commonly known as the crested secamone, is a flowering plant native to certain parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
